extendedIngredients.name: baby spinach
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 cups fresh baby spinach, coarsely chopped

extendedIngredients.name: colby monterey jack cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Colby-Monterey Jack cheese

extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound peeled and deveined cooked medium shrimp

recipes.title: Scalloped Shrimp and Potatoes

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 18 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Vampire Pinot Grigio Wine
productMatches.description: This dry, zestful combination is reminiscent of ripe pears and roses

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large skillet, combine the potatoes, contents of sauce mix packet, water and milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 8-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.                                                                                            Add shrimp and spinach. Cook and stir until spinach is wilted. Stir in cheese until melted.                                        Yield: 4 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Scalloped Shrimp and Potatoes  in  Simple & DeliciousDecember/January 2011, p31                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 cup equals 362 calories, 12 g fat (7 g saturated fat), 201 mg cholesterol, 925 mg sodium, 30 g carbohydrate, 4 g fiber, 33 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large skillet, combine the potatoes, contents of sauce mix packet, water and milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 8-10 minutes or until potatoes are tender, stirring occasionally.
Add shrimp and spinach. Cook and stir until spinach is wilted. Stir in cheese until melted.
